id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [ssd1306 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1306.html#configuration-variables)*

address.docs:
**int**: Manually specify the [I²C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) address of the display. Defaults to 0x3C.

*See also: [ssd1306 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1306.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `1s`.

*See also: [ssd1306 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1306.html#configuration-variables)*

CONFIG_SCHEMA.docs:
The `ssd1306_i2c` display platform allows you to use SSD1306 ([datasheet](https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/datasheets/SSD1306.pdf), [Adafruit](https://www.adafruit.com/product/326)), SSD1305 ([datasheet](https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/datasheets/SSD1305.pdf)), SH1107 ([datasheet](https://cdn-learn.adafruit.com/assets/assets/000/094/580/original/SH1107_datasheet.pdf), [Adafruit](https://www.adafruit.com/product/4650)) and SH1106 ([datasheet](https://www.elecrow.com/download/SH1106%20datasheet.pdf), [electrodragon](https://www.electrodragon.com/product/1-3-12864-blue-oled-display-iicspi/)) displays with ESPHome. Note that this component is for displays that are connected via the [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c). If your SSD1306/SSD1305 or SH1106 is connected via the 4-Wire [SPI bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi), see [Over SPI](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1306.html#ssd1306-spi).

*See also: [ssd1306 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1306.html#over-i2c)*
